title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: DNA methylation surrogates statistical models predict biological clinical outcomes using methylation values specific CpG sites. MethylSurroGetR provides comprehensive toolkit working surrogates, handling common challenges like missing data providing flexible calculation methods. vignette demonstrates main features package using example data.

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
code: library(MethylSurroGetR)

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: typical workflow involves four main steps: Create surrogate object surro_set() Handle missing probes reference_fill() Impute missing observations impute_obs() (needed) Calculate predictions surro_calc() Let’s walk step examples.

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: package includes sample datasets demonstration: methylation matrix : - CpG sites rows (CpG names row names) - Samples columns - Beta values (0-1 scale) entries

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Use surro_set() combine methylation data surrogate weights: Key points: - weights named numeric vector CpG names - intercept specifies weight element intercept term - function automatically aligns probes adds missing ones NA
code: # Extract weights as a named vector wts_vec <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df))  # Create surrogate object my_surro <- surro_set(   methyl = beta_matrix_comp,   weights = wts_vec,   intercept = "Intercept" ) #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # View the structure str(my_surro) #> List of 3 #>  $ methyl   : num [1:10, 1:5] 0.288 0.9 0.89 0.963 0.143 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg07" "cg08" "cg13" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:5] "samp1" "samp2" "samp3" "samp4" ... #>  $ weights  : Named num [1:10] -0.00908 -0.00116 0.00598 -0.00756 0.00122 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg03" "cg06" "cg07" ... #>  $ intercept: Named num 1.21 #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr "Intercept" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "methyl_surro"

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: data missing probes needed surrogate, use reference values: Fill types: "probes" - fill completely missing probes (recommended) "obs" - fill individual missing observations "" - Fill missing probes observations
code: # Extract reference values ref_vec <- setNames(ref_df$mean, rownames(ref_df))  # Fill missing probes with reference values my_surro <- reference_fill(   methyl_surro = my_surro,   reference = ref_vec,   type = "probes"  # Only fill completely missing probes ) #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy).

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Now calculate surrogate predictions: Available transformations: - "linear" - transformation (default) - "probability" - Logistic transformation (1 / (1 + exp(-x))) - "count" - Exponential transformation (exp(x))
code: # Calculate linear predictions predictions <- surro_calc(   methyl_surro = my_surro,   transform = "linear" )  print(predictions) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.197718 1.200473 1.206967 1.199796 1.198156

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Use methyl_miss() assess missing data patterns: shows: Number complete probes Probes partial missingness Completely missing probes Overall missing data rate
code: # Load data with missing values data(beta_matrix_miss)  # Create surrogate object surro_miss <- surro_set(   methyl = beta_matrix_miss,   weights = wts_vec,   intercept = "Intercept" ) #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # Analyze missing data missing_info <- methyl_miss(surro_miss) print(missing_info) #> Missing Data Summary for methyl_surro Object #> ============================================ #>  #> Total probes: 10 #> Total samples: 5 #> Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> Probes with missing observations: 2 (20.0%) #> Completely missing probes: 5 (50.0%) #> Overall missing rate: 58.0% #>  #> Probes with partial missing data: #> cg02 cg07  #>  0.6  0.2  #>  #> Completely missing probes: #> cg03, cg06, cg11, cg15, cg18

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: probes partial missingness, use impute_obs(): Parameters: method - “mean” “median” imputation min_nonmiss_prop - Minimum proportion non-missing values required (0-1) return_stats - Get detailed imputation statistics
code: # Impute using row means surro_imputed <- impute_obs(   methyl_surro = surro_miss,   method = "mean",   min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5,  # Only impute if ≥50% observed   verbose = TRUE ) #> Creating copy of methyl_surro object #> Starting imputation analysis... #> Found 29 missing values across 10 probes (58.0% of total values missing) #> Using mean imputation with minimum 50.0% non-missing data threshold #> Probe analysis: #> - 3 probes are complete (30.0%) #> - 5 probes are completely missing (50.0%) #> - 2 probes have partial missing data (20.0%) #> - 1 of 2 partial probes meet the 50.0% threshold for imputation #> - 1 probes do not meet threshold #> Calculating row-wise means for imputation... #> Performing imputation... #> Imputation completed successfully: #> - Imputed 1 missing values across 1 probes #> - Average imputation per probe: 1.0 values #> - 1 probes (10.0%) were not imputed due to insufficient data #> - Remaining missing values: 28 (56.0% of total) #> Recommendation: 1 probes were skipped (average 40.0% completeness). Consider: #> - Using reference_fill() to handle missing probes #> - Lowering min_nonmiss_prop threshold to 0.3 #> - Checking data quality with methyl_miss() #> Note: 5 completely missing probes detected. Use reference_fill() to address these before calculating surrogate values.

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
code: # Start with missing data data(beta_matrix_miss) data(wts_df) data(ref_df)  # Create vectors wts_vec <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df)) ref_vec <- setNames(ref_df$mean, rownames(ref_df))  # Full pipeline predictions_miss <- beta_matrix_miss |>   surro_set(weights = wts_vec, intercept = "Intercept") |>   reference_fill(reference = ref_vec, type = "probes") |>   impute_obs(method = "mean", min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5) |>   surro_calc(transform = "linear") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights. #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy). #> Imputed 1 values in 1 probes using mean method. #> 1 probes were not imputed because they did not meet the threshold. Use methyl_miss() to see missing probes. #> 3 samples omitted. Use impute_obs().  print(predictions_miss) #>    samp1    samp4  #> 1.197718 1.199796

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: continuous outcomes (e.g., estimated white blood cell counts):
code: wts_linear <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df))  predictions_linear <- beta_matrix_comp |>   surro_set(weights = wts_linear, intercept = "Intercept") |>   reference_fill(reference = ref_vec, type = "probes") |>   surro_calc(transform = "linear") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights. #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy).  print(predictions_linear) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.197718 1.200473 1.206967 1.199796 1.198156

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: binary outcomes (e.g., disease risk):
code: wts_prob <- setNames(wts_df$wt_prb, rownames(wts_df))  predictions_prob <- beta_matrix_comp |>   surro_set(weights = wts_prob, intercept = "Intercept") |>   reference_fill(reference = ref_vec, type = "probes") |>   surro_calc(transform = "probability") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights. #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy).  print(predictions_prob) #>     samp1     samp2     samp3     samp4     samp5  #> 0.5738002 0.6287368 0.6053712 0.6392831 0.5077835

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: count outcomes (e.g., cell counts):
code: wts_count <- setNames(wts_df$wt_cnt, rownames(wts_df))  predictions_count <- beta_matrix_comp |>   surro_set(weights = wts_count, intercept = "Intercept") |>   reference_fill(reference = ref_vec, type = "probes") |>   surro_calc(transform = "count") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights. #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy).  print(predictions_count) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 2.268177 2.469781 2.485737 2.467513 2.387315

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: analyses use M-values instead beta values. package provides conversion functions:
code: # Load M-value data data(mval_matrix_comp)  # Convert M-values to beta values beta_from_m <- convert_m_to_beta(mval_matrix_comp)  # Or convert beta values to M-values m_from_beta <- convert_beta_to_m(beta_matrix_comp)  # Verify round-trip conversion all.equal(beta_matrix_comp,            convert_m_to_beta(convert_beta_to_m(beta_matrix_comp))) #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
code: # Get detailed diagnostics results <- surro_calc(   my_surro,   transform = "linear",   return_diagnostics = TRUE )  # View diagnostics str(results$diagnostics) #> List of 14 #>  $ transform                  : chr "linear" #>  $ n_samples_original         : int 5 #>  $ n_probes_original          : int 10 #>  $ n_weights                  : int 10 #>  $ intercept_used             : logi TRUE #>  $ n_common_probes            : int 10 #>  $ n_missing_in_weights       : int 0 #>  $ n_missing_in_methyl        : int 0 #>  $ n_completely_missing_probes: int 0 #>  $ n_samples_with_missing     : int 0 #>  $ probes_set_to_zero         : int 0 #>  $ samples_removed            : int 0 #>  $ n_final_samples            : int 5 #>  $ final_result_range         : Named num [1:2] 1.2 1.21 #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:2] "min" "max"

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
code: # Get detailed imputation statistics surro_with_stats <- impute_obs(   surro_miss,   method = "mean",   return_stats = TRUE ) #> Imputed 4 values in 2 probes using mean method.  # View statistics print(surro_with_stats$imputation_stats) #> Imputation Statistics #> ===================== #> Method: mean #> Threshold: 0.0% non-missing data required #> Date: 2025-11-10 20:43:19.434648 #>  #> Probe Summary: #> - Total probes: 10 #> - Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> - Partially missing: 2 (20.0%) #> - Completely missing: 5 (50.0%) #>  #> Imputation Results: #> - Probes imputed: 2 of 2 eligible (100.0%) #> - Values imputed: 4 of 29 missing (13.8%) #> - Remaining missing: 25 values

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: detailed information processing:
code: # Verbose mode for debugging predictions_verbose <- surro_calc(   my_surro,   transform = "linear",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Always check missing data using methyl_miss() calculation Use appropriate reference values filling missing probes (ideally platform tissue type) Set reasonable thresholds imputation (e.g., min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5) Choose correct transformation based surrogate developed Validate results comparing known values expected ranges Document workflow including software versions parameters

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Solution: Ensure CpG names match methylation data weights. Check : Different naming conventions (e.g., “cg12345678” vs “cg12345678_1”) Leading/trailing whitespace Case sensitivity

what: Issue: Many samples removed due to missing data
title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Solution: Use impute_obs() surro_calc() Lower min_nonmiss_prop threshold appropriate Use reference values fill missing probes

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: Solution: Verify ’re using correct transformation Check input data correct scale (beta vs M-values) Ensure reference values appropriate data

title: Getting Started with MethylSurroGetR
text: MethylSurroGetR provides complete workflow : Organizing methylation data surrogate weights Handling missing probes observations Calculating predictions various transformations Diagnosing documenting analysis process information, see function documentation (?surro_calc, etc.) visit package website.

what: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
text: Converts methylation beta values M-values. Beta values represent methylation levels proportions (0-1), M-values log2 ratios provide better statistical properties analysis.

title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
code: convert_beta_to_m(methyl, in_place = FALSE)

title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
text: methyl matrix methylation values CpG sites row names samples column names. values must numeric. in_place Logical. TRUE, conversion performed -place save memory. WARNING: permanently modify original matrix. Default FALSE.

title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
text: matrix M-values corresponding input beta values.

title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m
text: Memory Usage: large matrices, setting in_place = TRUE can reduce memory usage approximately 50\ permanently modify original data. Numerical Stability: function automatically handles extreme beta values (0 1) otherwise result infinite M-values clamping small epsilon away boundaries. Value Ranges: Beta values 0 1. Values outside range generate warning conversion proceed.

title: Convert Beta Values to M-Values — convert_beta_to_m

what: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
title: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
text: Converts methylation M-values beta values. Beta values represent methylation levels proportions (0-1), M-values log2 ratios provide better statistical properties analysis.

title: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
code: convert_m_to_beta(methyl, in_place = FALSE)

title: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
text: methyl matrix methylation values CpG sites row names samples column names. values must numeric. in_place Logical. TRUE, conversion performed -place save memory. WARNING: permanently modify original matrix. Default FALSE.

title: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
text: matrix beta values corresponding input M-values.

title: Convert M-Values to Beta Values — convert_m_to_beta
text: Memory Usage: large matrices, setting in_place = TRUE can reduce memory usage approximately 50\ permanently modify original data. Numerical Stability: function automatically handles extreme M-values result beta values outside expected range (0 1).

what: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: function imputes missing values methylation matrix methyl_surro object using either mean median imputation. applies row-wise imputation based specified non-missing data proportion threshold.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
code: impute_obs(   methyl_surro,   method = c("mean", "median"),   min_nonmiss_prop = 0,   return_stats = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro, containing methylation matrix. method character string indicating imputation method. Must either "mean" "median". min_nonmiss_prop minimum proportion non-missing data required probe (row) imputation proceed. Must numeric value 0 1. return_stats Logical. TRUE, detailed imputation statistics added returned object. Default FALSE. verbose Logical. TRUE, detailed progress messages displayed. Default FALSE.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: methyl_surro object missing observations imputed, updating methylation matrix per given method threshold. return_stats = TRUE, additional imputation_stats component added containing detailed statistics imputation process.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: function uses vectorized operations efficient processing large matrices. Probes imputed meet minimum non-missing data threshold completely missing.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
code: # Load the sample data data(beta_matrix_miss) data(wts_df)  # Create weight vector and methyl_surro object wts_vec_lin <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df)) methyl_surro_miss <- surro_set(beta_matrix_miss, wts_vec_lin, "Intercept") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # Apply mean imputation with a specified threshold result <- impute_obs(methyl_surro_miss, "mean", min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5) #> Imputed 1 values in 1 probes using mean method. #> 1 probes were not imputed because they did not meet the threshold. Use methyl_miss() to see missing probes.  # Check the imputed result print(result$methyl) #>          samp1     samp2     samp3     samp4      samp5 #> cg02 0.2875775        NA        NA 0.8830174         NA #> cg07 0.8998250 0.2460877 0.6070843 0.3279207 0.95450365 #> cg08 0.8895393 0.6928034 0.6405068 0.9942698 0.65570580 #> cg13 0.9630242 0.9022990 0.6907053 0.7954674 0.02461368 #> cg17 0.1428000 0.4145463 0.4137243 0.3688455 0.15244475 #> cg03        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg06        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg11        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg15        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg18        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA  # Get detailed imputation statistics result_with_stats <- impute_obs(methyl_surro_miss, "mean",                                 min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5,                                 return_stats = TRUE,                                 verbose = TRUE) #> Creating copy of methyl_surro object #> Starting imputation analysis... #> Found 29 missing values across 10 probes (58.0% of total values missing) #> Using mean imputation with minimum 50.0% non-missing data threshold #> Probe analysis: #> - 3 probes are complete (30.0%) #> - 5 probes are completely missing (50.0%) #> - 2 probes have partial missing data (20.0%) #> - 1 of 2 partial probes meet the 50.0% threshold for imputation #> - 1 probes do not meet threshold #> Calculating row-wise means for imputation... #> Performing imputation... #> Imputation completed successfully: #> - Imputed 1 missing values across 1 probes #> - Average imputation per probe: 1.0 values #> - 1 probes (10.0%) were not imputed due to insufficient data #> - Remaining missing values: 28 (56.0% of total) #> Recommendation: 1 probes were skipped (average 40.0% completeness). Consider: #> - Using reference_fill() to handle missing probes #> - Lowering min_nonmiss_prop threshold to 0.3 #> - Checking data quality with methyl_miss() #> Note: 5 completely missing probes detected. Use reference_fill() to address these before calculating surrogate values. print(result_with_stats$imputation_stats) #> Imputation Statistics #> ===================== #> Method: mean #> Threshold: 50.0% non-missing data required #> Date: 2025-11-10 20:43:15.475214 #>  #> Probe Summary: #> - Total probes: 10 #> - Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> - Partially missing: 2 (20.0%) #> - Completely missing: 5 (50.0%) #>  #> Imputation Results: #> - Probes imputed: 1 of 2 eligible (50.0%) #> - Values imputed: 1 of 29 missing (3.4%) #> - Remaining missing: 28 values #>  #> Skipped probes: 1 (insufficient data)

what: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: function summarizes missing data methyl_surro object. identifies probes partial missing data (missing observations) probes missing samples (missing probes), along comprehensive summary statistics.

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
code: methyl_miss(methyl_surro)

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro.

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: list class methyl_miss following elements: missing_obs named numeric vector proportion missing observations probe value greater 0 less 1. missing_probes character vector probes missing samples. summary list containing summary statistics missing data patterns. summary component contains: total_probes Total number probes methylation matrix. total_samples Total number samples methylation matrix. n_complete_probes Number probes missing values. n_missing_obs Number probes partial missing data. n_missing_probes Number completely missing probes. overall_missing_rate Proportion matrix values missing. missing_obs_rate Proportion probes partial missing data. missing_probes_rate Proportion probes completely missing. complete_probes_rate Proportion probes complete.

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
code: # Load Methylation Beta Matrix data(beta_matrix_miss, package = "MethylSurroGetR")  # Load Weights Data Frame and create vector data(wts_df, package = "MethylSurroGetR") wts_vec_lin <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df))  # Build the methyl_surro Object surrogate <- surro_set(methyl = beta_matrix_miss,                        weights = wts_vec_lin,                        intercept = "Intercept") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # Summarizing Missing Values missing_summary <- methyl_miss(methyl_surro = surrogate) print(missing_summary) #> Missing Data Summary for methyl_surro Object #> ============================================ #>  #> Total probes: 10 #> Total samples: 5 #> Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> Probes with missing observations: 2 (20.0%) #> Completely missing probes: 5 (50.0%) #> Overall missing rate: 58.0% #>  #> Probes with partial missing data: #> cg02 cg07  #>  0.6  0.2  #>  #> Completely missing probes: #> cg03, cg06, cg11, cg15, cg18  # Access specific components missing_summary$missing_obs #> cg02 cg07  #>  0.6  0.2  missing_summary$summary$overall_missing_rate #> [1] 0.58

title: Reference Values Data Frame — ref_df
text: data frame containing population-level reference values methylation probes, used imputing completely missing probes target data lacks specific CpG sites. Values derived large-scale population methylation studies.

title: Reference Values Data Frame — ref_df
code: ref_df

title: Reference Values Data Frame — ref_df
text: data frame 20 rows (CpG probes) 2 columns: mean Population mean beta values probe median Population median beta values probe Primary applications: Filling completely missing probes reference_fill Providing population baselines comparison Supporting quality control outlier detection

title: Reference Values Data Frame — ref_df
text: Simulated data

title: Reference Values Data Frame — ref_df
code: data(ref_df) str(ref_df) #> 'data.frame':	20 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ mean  : num  0.399 0.662 0.495 0.528 0.677 ... #>  $ median: num  0.369 0.788 0.528 0.435 0.782 ...  # Extract columns as named vectors ref_mean <- setNames(ref_df$mean, rownames(ref_df)) ref_median <- setNames(ref_df$median, rownames(ref_df))

what: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: function fills missing probes methylation matrix methyl_surro object based external reference data. Users can specify imputation consider fully missing rows, partially missing rows, entire dataset.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
code: reference_fill(   methyl_surro,   reference,   type = c("probes", "obs", "all"),   return_stats = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro, containing methylation matrix. reference named numeric vector containing reference values probes impute missing data. type character string specifying scope filling missing data: "probes": Fill missing probes (completely missing rows). "obs": Fill missing observations (partially missing values). "": Fill missing probes observations. return_stats Logical. TRUE, detailed filling statistics added returned object. Default FALSE. verbose Logical. TRUE, detailed progress messages displayed. Default FALSE.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: methyl_surro object methylation matrix updated filling specified missing probes based reference data. return_stats = TRUE, additional reference_fill_stats component added containing detailed statistics filling process.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: function uses vectorized operations efficient processing large matrices. Reference values validated ensure fall within reasonable ranges methylation data (0-1 beta values, typically -10 10 M-values). Filling Strategy: function applies reference values consistently across samples probe, appropriate population-level reference data may capture individual-level variation.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
code: # Load the sample data data(beta_matrix_miss) data(wts_df) data(ref_df)  # Create weight vector and methyl_surro object wts_vec_lin <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df)) methyl_surro_miss <- surro_set(beta_matrix_miss, wts_vec_lin, "Intercept") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # Extract specific reference columns as named vectors ref_mean <- setNames(ref_df$mean, rownames(ref_df)) ref_median <- setNames(ref_df$median, rownames(ref_df))  # Apply reference filling using reference vector result <- reference_fill(methyl_surro = methyl_surro_miss,                          reference = ref_mean,                          type = "probes",                          verbose = TRUE) #> Starting reference filling analysis... #> Matrix dimensions: 10 probes x 5 samples #> Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> Partially missing probes: 2 (20.0%) #> Completely missing probes: 5 (50.0%) #> Reference data available for 20 probes #> Filling 5 completely missing probes with reference values... #> Filled 25 values using reference data (probes strategy). #> Reference filling completed successfully: #> - Filled 5 completely missing probes (25 values) #> - Total values filled: 25 (86.2% of originally missing) #> - Remaining missing values: 4 (8.0% of total)  # Check the result after filling print(result$methyl) #>          samp1     samp2     samp3     samp4      samp5 #> cg02 0.2875775        NA        NA 0.8830174         NA #> cg07 0.8998250 0.2460877        NA 0.3279207 0.95450365 #> cg08 0.8895393 0.6928034 0.6405068 0.9942698 0.65570580 #> cg13 0.9630242 0.9022990 0.6907053 0.7954674 0.02461368 #> cg17 0.1428000 0.4145463 0.4137243 0.3688455 0.15244475 #> cg03 0.4948262 0.4948262 0.4948262 0.4948262 0.49482616 #> cg06 0.5526592 0.5526592 0.5526592 0.5526592 0.55265924 #> cg11 0.4566024 0.4566024 0.4566024 0.4566024 0.45660238 #> cg15 0.4004940 0.4004940 0.4004940 0.4004940 0.40049405 #> cg18 0.3923206 0.3923206 0.3923206 0.3923206 0.39232059  # Get detailed filling statistics result_with_stats <- reference_fill(methyl_surro_miss, ref_median,                                      type = "all",                                      return_stats = TRUE, verbose = TRUE) #> Starting reference filling analysis... #> Matrix dimensions: 10 probes x 5 samples #> Complete probes: 3 (30.0%) #> Partially missing probes: 2 (20.0%) #> Completely missing probes: 5 (50.0%) #> Reference data available for 20 probes #> Filling 5 completely missing probes with reference values... #> Filling missing observations in 2 partially missing probes... #> Filled 29 values using reference data (all strategy). #> Reference filling completed successfully: #> - Filled 5 completely missing probes (25 values) #> - Filled missing observations in 2 probes (4 values) #> - Total values filled: 29 (100.0% of originally missing) #> - No missing values remaining print(result_with_stats$reference_fill_stats) #> Reference Filling Statistics #> ============================ #> Type: all #> Date: 2025-11-10 20:43:16.604793 #>  #> Matrix Summary: #> - Total probes: 10 #> - Total samples: 5 #> - Complete probes: 10 (100.0%) #> - Partially missing: 0 (0.0%) #> - Completely missing: 0 (0.0%) #>  #> Reference Data: #> - Available reference probes: 20 #> - Reference value range: 0.266 to 0.795 #>  #> Filling Results: #> - Complete probes filled: 5 (25 values) #> - Partial probes filled: 2 (4 values) #> - Total values filled: 29 of 29 missing (100.0%) #> - No missing values remaining

what: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: function calculates predicted values based provided methyl_surro object. probes (rows) completely missing, values set zero. Samples missing values removed calculation. function aligns multiplies weights methylation matrix, adds intercept specified, applies specified transformation results.

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
code: surro_calc(   methyl_surro,   transform = c("linear", "count", "probability"),   verbose = FALSE,   return_diagnostics = FALSE )

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro. transform character string specifying transformation apply. Can "linear", "count", "probability". verbose Logical. TRUE, detailed progress diagnostic messages displayed. Default FALSE. return_diagnostics Logical. TRUE, returns additional diagnostic information. Default FALSE.

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: return_diagnostics = FALSE: named vector predicted values names corresponding sample names. return_diagnostics = TRUE: list containing: predictions named vector predicted values diagnostics list diagnostic information including missing data handling calculation details

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: function performs validation processing steps: Validates probe-weight alignment methylation data weights Sets completely missing probes zero Removes samples missing values Calculates weighted sums applies transformations Provides detailed feedback data processing

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
code: # Load sample data data(beta_matrix_comp, package = "MethylSurroGetR") data(wts_df, package = "MethylSurroGetR")  # Create weight vector and methyl_surro object wts_vec_lin <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df)) methyl_surro_comp <- surro_set(beta_matrix_comp, wts_vec_lin, "Intercept") #> Added 5 missing probes with NA values (50.0% of weight probes missing from methylation data). #> Filtered methylation matrix from 15 to 10 probes to match weights.  # Basic calculation pred_lin <- surro_calc(methyl_surro_comp, transform = "linear") #> 5 probes set to zero. Use reference_fill(). print(pred_lin) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.196622 1.199377 1.205871 1.198700 1.197060   # With diagnostic information result_detailed <- surro_calc(methyl_surro_comp,                               transform = "linear",                               return_diagnostics = TRUE,                               verbose = TRUE) #> Starting surrogate calculation with linear transformation... #> Input: 10 probes x 5 samples #> Weights: 10 probe weights available #> Intercept: 1.211000 #> 5 probes set to zero. Use reference_fill(). #> Calculating weighted sum... #> Added intercept: 1.211000 #> Applying linear transformation... #> Calculation completed successfully: #> - Final sample count: 5 #> - Result range: 1.1966 to 1.2059 print(result_detailed$diagnostics) #> $transform #> [1] "linear" #>  #> $n_samples_original #> [1] 5 #>  #> $n_probes_original #> [1] 10 #>  #> $n_weights #> [1] 10 #>  #> $intercept_used #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $n_common_probes #> [1] 10 #>  #> $n_missing_in_weights #> [1] 0 #>  #> $n_missing_in_methyl #> [1] 0 #>  #> $n_completely_missing_probes #> [1] 5 #>  #> $n_samples_with_missing #> [1] 0 #>  #> $probes_set_to_zero #> [1] 5 #>  #> $samples_removed #> [1] 0 #>  #> $n_final_samples #> [1] 5 #>  #> $final_result_range #>      min      max  #> 1.196622 1.205871  #>

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: function takes methylation matrix named vector weights returns object class methyl_surro. function aligns methylation data weights, adding missing probes needed.

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
code: surro_set(methyl, weights, intercept = NULL)

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: methyl matrix methylation data CpG sites row names samples column names. values must numeric. weights named numeric vector CpG site names, representing regression weights. intercept optional name intercept term within weights. provided, specified intercept separated weights stored separately.

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: object class methyl_surro containing following components: methyl methylation matrix, filtered include probes present weights, additional rows NAs added weights present methylation data. weights named numeric vector weights (excluding intercept specified). intercept numeric value intercept, provided. NULL otherwise.

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: function performs following operations: Validates input format structure Extracts intercept weights specified Filters methylation matrix include probes present weights Adds rows NA values weight probes present methylation data Returns properly structured methyl_surro object Missing probes (weights methylation data) handled using reference_fill calculating surrogate values.

title: Regression Weights Data Frame — wts_df
text: data frame containing regression weights three different simulated statistical models.

title: Regression Weights Data Frame — wts_df
code: wts_df

title: Regression Weights Data Frame — wts_df
text: data frame 11 rows 3 columns: wt_lin Linear regression weights continuous outcomes wt_prb Logistic regression weights binary outcomes (log-odds scale) wt_cnt Poisson regression weights count outcomes (log scale) Row names represent 10 CpG probe identifiers plus "Intercept" term. Model types demonstrated: Linear: Continuous phenotype prediction Logistic: Binary classification (disease status, etc.) Poisson: Count-based outcomes (cell counts, etc.)

title: Regression Weights Data Frame — wts_df
text: Simulated data

title: Regression Weights Data Frame — wts_df
code: data(wts_df) str(wts_df) #> 'data.frame':	11 obs. of  3 variables: #>  $ wt_lin: num  -0.00908 -0.00116 0.00598 -0.00756 0.00122 ... #>  $ wt_prb: num  0.165 -0.405 -0.116 -0.226 0.315 ... #>  $ wt_cnt: num  0.0509 0.02584 0.04204 -0.09988 -0.00494 ...  # Extract weights vectors linear_weights <- setNames(wts_df$wt_lin, rownames(wts_df)) logistic_weights <- setNames(wts_df$wt_prb, rownames(wts_df)) poisson_weights <- setNames(wts_df$wt_cnt, rownames(wts_df))

title: MethylSurroGetR 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial package development surro_set() - Create surrogate objects methylation data weights reference_fill() - Fill missing probes reference values impute_obs() - Impute missing observations using mean median surro_calc() - Calculate surrogate predictions multiple transformations Missing data assessment methyl_miss() convert_beta_to_m() - Convert beta values M-values convert_m_to_beta() - Convert M-values beta values Comprehensive input validation error messages Detailed diagnostic reporting options Support linear, probability (logistic), count (Poisson) transformations Example datasets testing learning

title: MethylSurroGetR 0.0.0.9000
text: Added “Getting Started MethylSurroGetR” vignette Complete function documentation examples Package website https://jagoode27.github.io/MethylSurroGetR/
